snippet: President Obama’s second-term priorities — the deficit, gun safety and immigration — may hinge on his ability to inject himself into negotiations to just the right degree.
abstract: White House Memo; success of Pres Obama’s priorities for his second-term agenda, including long-range budget deficit reduction, gun safety and changes to immigration law, may hinge on his legislative approach to deeply polarized Congress; Obama must walk fine line so that he remains involved in negotiations--but not too much or too little--in order to avoid criticism from Republicans.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s second-term priorities — the deficit, gun safety and immigration — may hinge on his ability to inject himself into negotiations to just the right degree.

headline.seo: Obama Must Walk Fine Line as Congress Weighs Agenda
headline.main: Obama Must Walk Fine Line as Congress Takes Up Agenda
headline.print_headline: Obama Must Walk Fine Line As Congress Takes Up Agenda
